title: HOW TO GROW YOUR OWN ORGANIC VEGETABLES AND HERBS AT HOME PART 1

tasks.task: Assemble a vegetable box for seed starting.
subtasks: Cut the dog ear ends off the fence boards.
Create a 6-foot length from each fence board.
Cut an additional fence board into two pieces for ends.
Assemble the three pieces into a box measuring 6 feet by 30 inches.
Prepare a soaker hose and wire for irrigation.
Position the soaker hose and wire near the seedling rows.
Use organic soil from bags to fill the box, ensuring proper moisture retention.
Incorporate food waste into the soil to act as fertilizer.

tasks.task: Create a system for starting seeds in a box.
subtasks: Determine the appropriate number of seeds per row considering germination rates.
Plant seeds in rows, overseeding to account for potential failures.
Cover the seeds with a thin layer of soil.
Water the seeds using the soaker hose setup.
Monitor the seedlings as they emerge, ensuring consistent moisture.

tasks.task: Compost food waste for garden use.
subtasks: Collect food scraps and place them at the bottom of the vegetable box.
Allow the food waste to decompose, providing nutrients to the soil.
